paper_abstract: APPLICATION LAUNCH TIME IN MOBILE SYSTEMS CAN ADVERSELY AFFECT USER EXPERIENCE. ANDROID EMPLOYS SEVERAL SOFTWARE TECHNIQUES TO REDUCE APPLICATION LAUNCH TIME, BUT NOT MUCH RESEARCH HAS BEEN DONE FROM A HARDWARE PERSPECTIVE. IN THIS ARTICLE, THE AUTHORS ANALYZE MEMORY USAGE PATTERNS OF ANDROID APPLICATIONS, SUGGEST SEVERAL HARDWARE OPTIMIZATION TECHNIQUES, AND DEMONSTRATE HOW USING NONVOLATILE MEMORY CAN ACCELERATE START-UP TIME.
paper_title: ACCELERATING APPLICATION START-UP WITH NONVOLATILE MEMORY IN ANDROID SYSTEMS
